name: Homemade Bolognese Sauce
description: Bolognese is a rich, meaty tomato sauce made with ground beef and pork. It's simmered with a splash of wine and seasonings to create a restaurant worthy pasta bolognese at home!

video.name: Homemade Bolognese Sauce
video.description: Bolognese Sauce is a pasta staple and a family pleasing recipe! A rich tomato based meat sauce with beef and pork is combined with onions, garlic, and veggies for an Italian favorite.

recipeIngredient: 1 ¼ cups red wine (or beef broth)
1 can whole tomatoes (with juices, 28 ounces each)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, cook onion in oil over medium heat until softened, about 3 to 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pot, cook onion in oil over medium heat until softened, about 3 to 4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add garlic, carrot, and celery, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add garlic, carrot, and celery, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add beef and pork. Break it up with a wooden spoon, until no pink remains. Drain fat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add beef and pork. Break it up with a wooden spoon, until no pink remains. Drain fat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the wine and simmer uncovered until evaporated, about 10 minutes. Add milk and simmer uncovered until evaporated, about 8 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the wine and simmer uncovered until evaporated, about 10 minutes. Add milk and simmer uncovered until evaporated, about 8 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in tomatoes with juice, tomato paste, Italian seasoning, and bay leaf. Break tomatoes up with a spoon. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until thickened. Season with salt & pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in tomatoes with juice, tomato paste, Italian seasoning, and bay leaf. Break tomatoes up with a spoon. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until thickened. Season with salt & pepper to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook pasta according to package directions. Reserve 1 ½ cups of pasta water and drain the pasta well.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook pasta according to package directions. Reserve 1 ½ cups of pasta water and drain the pasta well.

recipeInstructions.text: Toss pasta with sauce, adding pasta water to thin it out if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Toss pasta with sauce, adding pasta water to thin it out if needed.

review.reviewBody: pea milk is vegan and AMAZING in creamy sauces and risotto!

My husband spent all afternoon yesterday making this sauce. It was well worth it. He also made pasta from scratch to go with it..YUM!  The yield on the recipe says 6 servings and the nutritional info says 359 per serving..what size serving is that based on. We ended up with at least 8 servings and maybe more. What do you consider a serving? 1/4 cup, 1/2 cup?  Thanks.
I will be following this recipe again! my first attempt and with a little extra time and simmer, this bolognese cane out great! merlot wine was my choice. fresh rosemary and oregano for a twist.
This recipe is amazing so blessed to have the internet
This is the best!!  My husband is Italian and this is his favorite meal I make for him. Thank you!

Tried making this for dinner last night! And man, this is so good! I didn’t have any bay leafs on me but it still tasted good!!! Probably one of the best bolognese pasta I have tried! Will make it more next time for friends and Family!!
My first bolognese! Thank you for the recipe. I didn’t have canned whole tomatoes and had to use sauce instead but still came out very good. Just froze the leftovers for a future easy weeknight meal.
I never leave reviews but I felt wrong not doing so after making this once a week for the last 6 months. This is my favorite bolognese ever and I’m Italian. Thank you!
Excellent, easy to make recipe! I have made it multiple times :) You can add your own spices for extra flavours.

It was good. Easy directions. And I added an extra carrot and celery with a few mushrooms stems. my household enjoyed it, but they prefer homemade spaghetti. I however, loved the wine accents and veggies.

keywords: best recipe, bolognese, bolognese sauce, how to make
